title: Drawing, "Panel with the Exploits of Theseus", ca. 1800
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on paper, lined with white heavy paper and framed by blue color paper border colored light brown and black
markings: watermark: ADRIANN ROG(GE) and Strassburg bend and lily (incomplete). CIN1782
signed: Signed bottom left:  "C. Normand in. et fecit."
provenance: Collection of Leon Decloux (in his collection in 1906)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Design for a wall panel.  The composition shows episodes from the lives of Theseus, interspersed amidst a finely drawn, elaborate display of garlands, urns, nymphs, leafy arbors, pavilions and arabesques.  From the bottom up the scenes represent:  Theseus discovering the sword and sandals of his father, Theseus slaying the Minotaur, Theseus abducting Antiope, and Theseus being rescued by Hercules.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource
